de.systemagmbh.tools.math
Class CSysInterval

java.lang.Object
  de.systemagmbh.tools.math.CSysInterval
public class CSysInterval
extends Object

The class CSysInterval is a wrapper for numeric Intervals. In the class CSysMathTool you will see some methods requiring Intervals as argument. Some functions in the class CSysStatistics return Intervals as result. CSysInterval is a simple class, but really useful.

Version:
$Revision: 1.6 $
Author:
H.Helmstreit

Method Detail

decode

public static CSysInterval decode(String notation)
                           throws NumberFormatException
Convert a String into a CSysInterval The String representation of an Interval is [lower;upper] if the upper and lower boundary is included ]lower;upper[ if the upper and lower boundary is excluded. Other combinations are also possible.

Parameters:
notation - The String notation of the CSysInterval
Returns:
the created interval.
Throws:
NumberFormatException - if the conversion cannot be done

setIncludes

public void setIncludes(boolean lower,
                        boolean upper)
Define inclusions of CSysInterval boundaries.

Parameters:
lower - include lower limit or not
upper - include upper limit or not

equals

public boolean equals(Object obj)
Check if another object is equal to this.

Parameters:
obj - The object to compare against.
Returns:
true if the other object is equal to this.

toString

public String toString()
Return math standard interval notation. The String representation of an Interval is [lower;upper] if the upper and lower boundary is included ]lower;upper[ if the upper and lower boundary is excluded. Other combinations are also possible. e.g. ]0.5; 1.2]. In this example the lower value (0.5) is not included in the CSysInterval, the upper (1.2) is.

Returns:
String representation of math standard interval notation

getRange

public double getRange()
Calculate CSysInterval Range.

Returns:
the Range (length) of the CSysInterval

getMean

public double getMean()
Calculate mid of CSysInterval.

Returns:
the mid of the CSysInterval
